item.title: On Induced Online Ramsey Number of Paths, Cycles, and Trees
item.author: blazeva1 -a- fit.cvut.cz <Václav Blažej> (Václav Blažej)
item.description: Abstract An online Ramsey game is a game between Builder and Painter, alternating in turns. They are given a graph $H$ and a graph $G$ of an infinite set of independent vertices. In each round Builder draws an edge and Painter colors it either red or blue. Builder wins if after some finite round there is a monochromatic copy of the graph $H$, otherwise Painter wins. The online Ramsey number $\widetilde r(H)$ is the minimum number of rounds such that Builder can force a monochromatic copy of $H$ in $G$.
